definition: item of storytelling or performed dialogue (folk arts)/sketch
paragraph/section/segment/stage (of a process)/classifier for stories, periods of time, lengths of thread etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: It's seems this part of the ancient text was indexical in nature!
sentences.chinese: 看仿佛这个段子的那古代的原文一次有了索引的种类。

sentences.english: Today, I sent a kinky text message to my boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 今天我给男朋友发了条黄段子。

sentences.english: Lyrics vary greatly if the same piece is sung by different artists.
sentences.chinese: 不同的艺术家在唱同样的段子时，鼓词会有很大不同。

sentences.english: This month, it decreed that comedy must not be "derogatory".
sentences.chinese: 本月，他们宣称喜剧段子必须不能带有“贬低色彩”。

sentences.english: Alwayss have a few interesting and unique stories.
sentences.chinese: 随时有些好玩又不合人家撞车的小段子。

sentences.english: Use your best jokes when writing your movie script.
sentences.chinese: 把你原创的最幽默的笑话和段子写入剧本。

sentences.english: Older relatives feel comfortable telling sex jokes around you.
sentences.chinese: 年长的亲戚们放开在你面前讲荤段子了。

definition: branch/stem/stalk/CL:根[gen1]/to block/to hinder/(Tw) interesting, fresh, or amusing subject matter or scenario
comedic material/(in reference to a person) laughingstock/butt of jokes
spoof (web-based genre in PRC, acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)
quotation (from a book or existing source)
popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
